title: UNHCR continues aid to Syrian refugees in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT， May 5 (Xinhua) -- The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) said on Saturday that no new refugees from Syria have been registered since last week， and that the agency is working closely with the Lebanese government and other partners to help over 24，000 Syrian refugees in Lebanon.
cleanContent: BEIRUT, May 5 (Xinhua) -- The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) said on Saturday that no new refugees from Syria have been registered since last week, and that the agency is working closely with the Lebanese government and other partners to help over 24,000 Syrian refugees in Lebanon.In a weekly update, the UNHCR said that "13,405 refugees have been registered in the north (of Lebanon) in coordination with the Higher Relief Council."The report noted that "there are around 9,250 Syrian refugees in the Bekaa... and limited number of refugees in (Lebanon's northern city of) Beirut, including 801 registered people."The report also said that 13 injured Syrians have been submitted to hospitals for treatment.																																																																								|  |
